Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; cream slip; exterior, from top: band of rays, some in added red; dividing band consisting of billets; painted decoration consisting of part of female figure's head with hair in krobylos, to left; dot rosette and larger blob rosette as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Painter of the running satyrs (probably)
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 246, no. 3)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D p. 81, no. 53, pl. IV, no. 53)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.035)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
